Sentencas: Significant recent interest has been directed towards the relationship between interfaces and reports of enhanced ionic conductivity.
Titulo: Anomalous Oxidation States in Multilayers for Fuel Cell Applications

Sentencas: To gain a greater understanding of the effects of hetero-interfaces on ionic conductivity, advanced analytical techniques including electron microscopy (TEM/STEM), electron energy loss spectroscopy (EELS), and secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS) are used to characterize CeO2/Ce0.85Sm0.15O2 multilayer thin films grown by pulsed laser deposition.
Titulo: Anomalous Oxidation States in Multilayers for Fuel Cell Applications

Sentencas: High quality growth is observed, but ionic conductivity measured by impedance spectroscopy and O-18 tracer experiments is consistent with bulk materials.
Titulo: Anomalous Oxidation States in Multilayers for Fuel Cell Applications

Sentencas: EELS analysis reveals the unusual situation of layers containing only Ce(IV) adjacent to layers containing both Ce(III) and Ce(IV).
Titulo: Anomalous Oxidation States in Multilayers for Fuel Cell Applications

Sentencas: Post oxygen annealing induced oxygen diffusion and mixed oxidation states in both layers, but only in the vicinity of low angle grain boundaries perpendicular to the layers.
Titulo: Anomalous Oxidation States in Multilayers for Fuel Cell Applications

Sentencas: The implications of the anomalous behavior of the Ce oxidation states on the design of novel electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells is discussed.
Titulo: Anomalous Oxidation States in Multilayers for Fuel Cell Applications
